Here are simplified guidelines on how to operate an English language app for visually impaired and handicap users through voice mode 


Turn on Voice Mode: Check the app's settings for an accessibility or voice mode option and turn it on.


Learn Voice Commands: Take time to familiarize yourself with the app's voice commands by checking its documentation or help section. Common commands may include "Open menu," "Select," "Go back," "Select one" , select basic quiz history" and "exit voice mode.", “exit app”, “repeat menu”.
Speak Clearly: Use clear and natural pronunciation when giving voice commands. Speak at a moderate pace and avoid slurring words.


Be Patient: Voice recognition may not always be perfect, so be patient if the app doesn't interpret your commands correctly. Try repeating or rephrasing the command if needed.


Minimize Background Noise: Use the app in a quiet environment to reduce background noise that may interfere with voice recognition.


Explore App Features: Check if the app has text-to-speech or other accessibility features designed for visually impaired and handicap users.


"Try Again" Option: If a voice command is not recognized, look for a "Try Again" option or button, which allows you to repeat the command without starting over. If you are a visually impaired and physically challenged learner and need to touch the screen, the voice mode will be activated again.
